conclusion: Analyze how shadows A, B, C, and D change with light source movement.
Image shows colored blocks (yellow, purple, brown, blue) and fabric-like objects (red, multicolored).
Blocks A, B, C, and D are elevated above slabs, casting shadows labeled A, B, C, and D.
Assume initial light source position is front right above objects.
Initial shadows are cast to the back left of each object.
Blocks are clustered in the center of the table; A and B on the left, C and D on the right.
Initial shadow positions: A and B's shadows are more to the left and back, C and D's shadows are more to the right but still back and left.
Light source moves to back left above objects.
With light in back left, shadows cast to front right.
New shadow positions: A, B, C, D shadows shift to front right of respective objects.
Shadows maintain same relative arrangement as objects but direction flips.
Height of objects affects shadow displacement; assume height constant.
Light source angle assumed similar but shifts position.
Blocks are cubic, shadows roughly square but distorted by angle.
Summarize positional changes: Shadows move from back left to front right.
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, D move to front right of objects, maintaining relative positions.
